answers.answer: Talk to your doctor about the parasthesia and address your question re: alchohol with him. He may need to run some blood work to make sure your autoimmune condition is under control, check for diabetes etc. While you're there ask him how much you can drink

question: I drink a REALISTIC average of 7-10 drink a week. Some days none some days 2 or occasionally more. Several months ago I started experience paresthesia. I know "heavy intake" of alcohol can cause this. I also have auto immune issues which are more likely the culprit, but I was wondering if my consumption is considered heavy. I never thought I had a problem as I often leave beer or wine unfinished. I stopped for over a month at the onset of the paresthesia with no problem but no change in my paresthia. I do enjoy it and don't think I have a problem. Is really  this amount considered heavy consumption?
title: Alcohol and paresthesia
